title: How Many Calories in a Peanut and Jelly Sandwich?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a peanut and jelly sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Peanut and Jelly Sandwich?
assumptions: 2 slices white bread, 2 tbsp creamy peanut butter, 1 tbsp grape jelly; no added butter or extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, peanut butter brand, jelly sweetness, portion sizes, and preparation. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard peanut butter and jelly sandwich contains about 450 calories and 15 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories are in a peanut butter and jelly sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 450 calories for a standard version with 2 slices bread, 2 tbsp PB, and 1 tbsp jelly.

faqs.q: What are the macros for a PB&J sandwich?
faqs.a: About 60 g carbs, 20 g fat, 15 g protein, and 4 g fiber.

faqs.q: Does the type of bread affect calories in a peanut and jelly sandwich?
faqs.a: Yes—whole wheat adds fiber but similar calories; rye or sourdough may vary by 20-50 kcal.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in a peanut butter and jelly sandwich?
faqs.a: Around 20 g, mostly from the jelly; opt for low-sugar options to reduce it.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie peanut and jelly sandwich?
faqs.a: Yes—use thin bread slices, reduced-fat PB, or less jelly to cut 50-100 kcal.
